<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good Friday morning. </strong>Any of youse guys coming with us to SopranosCon tomorrow? The festival, held in North Jersey’s Meadowlands, will celebrate the show’s 20th birthday with lots of cast members, sightseeing tours, and an Italian feast. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now for a hypothetical. You’re stranded on a deserted island and you can only bring one: <em>Mad Men</em>, <em>Sopranos</em>, <em>The Wire</em>, <em>Breaking Bad</em>. Tough call...</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/21/tesla-unveils-cybertruck?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
I Am Cybertruck. I Come in Peace.
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="truck " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0Mzk3MzU5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tesla</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When Tesla CEO Elon Musk <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/21/tesla-cybertruck-unveiled.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">introduced</a> his company’s first electric pickup truck in Los Angeles yesterday, he said, “It doesn’t look like anything else.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He got that right. The Cybertruck is Tesla’s sixth vehicle and definitely its most bizarre...but so was the presentation. When Musk asked Chief Designer Franz von Holzhausen to throw a metal ball at the truck to demonstrate its toughness, Franz shattered a window. Twice.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, the Cybertruck has nowhere to go but up. The <a href="https://www.engadget.com/2019/11/21/tesla-unveils-its-cybertruck/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">starting price</a> is $39,900 and it can go zero to 60 in about 2.9 seconds, according to Musk. The truck has three battery ranges, the top of which can last 500+ miles per charge.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Musk outdid himself with the pre-launch hype.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Yesterday </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1197627433970589696?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">he tweeted</a></span><span>, “Tesla Cybertruck (pressurized edition) will be official truck of Mars.” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“I think the Tesla side of the truck is our best product ever,” he told investors on the company’s last earnings call. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So why get into pickups? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What if we told you that the three top-selling vehicles in the U.S. are the Ford F-150, Chevy Silverado, and Ram 1500. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last year, full-size truck sales </span><span><a href="https://www.thedrive.com/news/26907/you-dont-need-a-full-size-pickup-truck-you-need-a-cowboy-costume?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grew</a></span><span> to almost 2.5 million units—the rest of the new car market was basically flat, reports The Drive.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Full-size truck owners are the </span><span><a href="https://b2b.autotrader.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/PICKUP-TRUCK-STUDY.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most loyal</a></span><span> out of any vehicle category. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Pickups and SUVs currently account for seven out of 10 U.S. vehicle sales. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And you already probably knew this in your gut, but people buy trucks even when they don’t <em>really </em>need them. 75% of truck owners tow something one time a year or less, according to Strategic Vision data cited by The Drive. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sounds like an opportunity for Tesla, but there’s still <a href="https://qz.com/1753005/teslas-pick-up-truck-is-coming-tonight/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">product-market fit</a> to worry about. After all, making an electric pickup truck is like topping an Impossible Burger with bacon—who’s your target customer?</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Only 4% of truck buyers say they’d pay extra for a more fuel efficient vehicle. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Musk has been able to change the conversation around electric vehicles before. This could be his biggest challenge yet.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BROKERAGE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/21/schwab-brokers-td-ameritrade-deal?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Schwab Brokers TD Ameritrade Deal
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Schwab tries to eat TD Ameritrade " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0Mzc1NDIzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Brokerage power forward Charles Schwab is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/21/charles-schwab-in-talks-to-buy-td-ameritrade-a-deal-could-be-announced-as-early-as-today-source-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in talks</a> to buy small forward TD Ameritrade, CNBC first reported yesterday. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A deal would cost Schwab over $25 billion, </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/c1832f20-0c50-11ea-bb52-34c8d9dc6d84?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the FT</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Free stock trading platforms like Robinhood and Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s rate-slashing rampage have created last-cup-in-beer-pong pressure for the brokerage industry. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Last month, Schwab pulled the nuclear option and eliminated commissions.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>TD Ameritrade did the same right after—but it's poised to take a </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-21/schwab-to-buy-td-ameritrade-in-reshaping-of-online-brokerages?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">much bigger hit</a></span><span>. 36% of TD's 2018 net revenue came from commissions vs. Schwab’s 7%.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Consolidation might raise some D.C. eyebrows over antitrust. </strong>Together, the two firms claim up to 70% of the registered investment advisor custody market, per KBW data cited by Reuters. The <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-td-ameritrade-m-a-charles-schwab/charles-schwab-in-talks-to-buy-smaller-rival-td-ameritrade-cnbc-idUSKBN1XV16S?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">combined company</a> would have around $5 trillion in assets. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>industry disruption has forced firms to shift focus from trading to managing those customer assets. In 2018, half of Schwab’s $10+ billion in revenue came from interest earned.</p>

STARTUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/21/wework-lay-off-2400?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
WeOut
</font></a>
</h1>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="wework vacuum running over floor " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1574367641.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="wework vacuum running over floor " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1574367641.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WeWork is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/21/wework-lays-off-2400-employees.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">laying off</a> 2,400 employees, nearly 20% of its global workforce. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What had been everyone’s favorite tragicomedy is now just a disaster. WeWork swung for an IPO in September but missed <em>badly</em>—investors decided that huge losses, a lack of focus, and sketchy corporate governance presented risks they weren’t willing to take. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Then, WeWork’s valuation sank from $47 billion to ~$8 billion following a bailout from the Japanese conglomerate SoftBank, which had already committed </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-16/softbank-said-to-plan-5-billion-rescue-financing-for-wework?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $10 billion</a></span><span> to WeWork.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>This round of layoffs will inevitably be compared to the departure of cofounder Adam Neumann, who stepped down with an exit package worth around $1 billion. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In a letter to management earlier this month, around 150 employees </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/08/business/wework-employees-letter.html?module=inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slammed Neumann</a></span><span>. They wrote, “We don’t want to be defined by the scandals, the corruption, and the greed exhibited by the company’s leadership.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>WeWork needs a drastic overhaul if it wants another crack at an IPO. It lost $1.25 billion last quarter, more than double its losses in Q3 2018.</p>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/21/google-tightens-political-ad-targeting?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Google officially joined the “at least we’re doing more than Facebook” club and announced adjustments to political ad targeting this week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Advertisers today can tailor ads to individuals’ political leanings (left, right, independent, Never Brewers). Moving forward, targeting categories are <a href="https://www.blog.google/technology/ads/update-our-political-ads-policy/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">broadening</a> to age, gender, postal code, and your internet browsing history. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Changes roll out in the U.K. in the next week, the EU by year’s end, and everywhere else Jan. 6. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Google said “demonstrably false claims” that could subvert electoral processes are still prohibited.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The rest of the pack</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last Friday, Twitter finally <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/15/twitter-gives-details-political-ad-policy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained in detail</a> the political ad ban taking effect today (including walking back an outright ban on "issue-based" advertisers). And Snap CEO Evan Spiegel <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/18/snapchat-fact-checks-political-ads-unlike-facebook-ceo-evan-spiegel.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> his platform has dedicated fact-checkers for ads. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even Facebook’s trying to get away from what Facebook’s doing. Company execs are reportedly considering changes to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/13/sen-elizabeth-warren-runs-knowingly-false-ads-check-facebook?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">controversial</a> political ad policies, the WSJ <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-discussing-potential-changes-to-political-ad-policy-11574352887?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>For social media companies, the debate over political ad policies seems to be, “Which one will make us look less bad?”</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/21/polling-high-morning-brews-person-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Quiz Pro Quo
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Subscribes to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-turnout/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=turnout&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Turnout</a>. Always shares ChapStick. Polling high for Morning Brew's <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1196922376535126017?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Person of the Year</a>. It’s the Brew’s Weekly News Quiz.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. <strong style="color:#000">We told you this was coming. </strong>What eight-letter Swedish word means “<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/19/easyjet-begin-offsetting-fuel-emissions?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">flight shame</a>” in English? Here’s the longer definition: “the inherent guilt that an individual feels as a result of one’s aviation-related carbon footprint.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. Which ride-hailing app just <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/18/juno-leaves-new-york?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shut down operations</a> in NYC, leaving its loyal customers to brave the L train once again?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. <strong style="color:#000">Fill in the blank:</strong> _____ has inked a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/18/airbnb-books-big-sponsorship-olympics?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mega-deal</a> to sponsor the Olympic Games until 2028.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. Which <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/18/coty-buys-majority-stake-kylie-cosmetics?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beauty deal</a> didn’t go down this quarter, or ever?</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Coty bought a 51% stake in Kylie Cosmetics for $600 million</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The L’Oréal Group bought Peach & Lily for $550 million</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Estée Lauder bought the remaining share of Have & Be for $1.1 billion</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Shiseido bought Drunk Elephant for $845 million</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. A <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/20/new-study-shines-light-ubers-effect-binge-drinking?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">study</a> published last week found that heavy drinking jumped 9% on average within a couple of years of what event? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Answers: </em></strong><em>1. flygskam  2. Juno 3. Airbnb 4. the L’Oréal Group did not buy Peach & Lily 5. Uber arriving into the market </em></sup></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<td style="padding:15px">

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Our weekend challenge to you: </strong></span><span>Read Slate's </span><span><a href="https://slate.com/human-interest/2019/11/50-best-nonfiction-books.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">50 best nonfiction books</a></span><span> from the last 25 years. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The World’s Biggest Liar</strong></span><span> competition was </span><span><a href="https://www.santonbridgeinn.com/the-worlds-bigest-liar?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">held yesterday</a></span><span> in England, where competitors had five minutes to tell the biggest lie they could. </span><span><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/blogs/sideshow/world-biggest-liar-annual-competition-underway-england-015405771.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Past winners</a></span><span> have convinced the audience that 1) people were forced to ride camels to work because of climate change and 2) they faced off against Prince Charles in a snail race. </li>
</ul>
</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Written by
<a href="https://twitter.com/Neal_Freyman" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Neal Freyman</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/ElizaCarter34" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Eliza Carter</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/its_ahickey" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Alex Hickey</a>, and <a href="https://twitter.com/jamiekaywilde" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Jamie Wilde</a>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nAUTO\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nI Am Cybertruck. I Come in Peace.\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"truck \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0Mzk3MzU5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eTesla\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen Tesla CEO Elon Musk \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/21/tesla-cybertruck-unveiled.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eintroduced\u003c/a\u003e his company’s first electric pickup truck in Los Angeles yesterday, he said, “It doesn’t look like anything else.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHe got that right. The Cybertruck is Tesla’s sixth vehicle and definitely its most bizarre...but so was the presentation. When Musk asked Chief Designer Franz von Holzhausen to throw a metal ball at the truck to demonstrate its toughness, Franz shattered a window. Twice.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, the Cybertruck has nowhere to go but up. The \u003ca href=\"https://www.engadget.com/2019/11/21/tesla-unveils-its-cybertruck/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estarting price\u003c/a\u003e is $39,900 and it can go zero to 60 in about 2.9 seconds, according to Musk. The truck has three battery ranges, the top of which can last 500+ miles per charge.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eMusk outdid himself with the pre-launch hype.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYesterday \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1197627433970589696?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehe tweeted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, “Tesla Cybertruck (pressurized edition) will be official truck of Mars.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“I think the Tesla side of the truck is our best product ever,” he told investors on the company’s last earnings call. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo why get into pickups? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat if we told you that the three top-selling vehicles in the U.S. are the Ford F-150, Chevy Silverado, and Ram 1500. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast year, full-size truck sales \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.thedrive.com/news/26907/you-dont-need-a-full-size-pickup-truck-you-need-a-cowboy-costume?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrew\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to almost 2.5 million units—the rest of the new car market was basically flat, reports The Drive.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFull-size truck owners are the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://b2b.autotrader.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/PICKUP-TRUCK-STUDY.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost loyal\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e out of any vehicle category. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePickups and SUVs currently account for seven out of 10 U.S. vehicle sales. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd you already probably knew this in your gut, but people buy trucks even when they don’t \u003cem\u003ereally \u003c/em\u003eneed them. 75% of truck owners tow something one time a year or less, according to Strategic Vision data cited by The Drive. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSounds like an opportunity for Tesla, but there’s still \u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/1753005/teslas-pick-up-truck-is-coming-tonight/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproduct-market fit\u003c/a\u003e to worry about. After all, making an electric pickup truck is like topping an Impossible Burger with bacon—who’s your target customer?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOnly 4% of truck buyers say they’d pay extra for a more fuel efficient vehicle. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eMusk has been able to change the conversation around electric vehicles before. FT\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Free stock trading platforms like Robinhood and Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s rate-slashing rampage have created last-cup-in-beer-pong pressure for the brokerage industry. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLast month, Schwab pulled the nuclear option and eliminated commissions.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTD Ameritrade did the same right after—but it's poised to take a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-21/schwab-to-buy-td-ameritrade-in-reshaping-of-online-brokerages?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emuch bigger hit\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. 36% of TD's 2018 net revenue came from commissions vs. Schwab’s 7%.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eConsolidation might raise some D.C. eyebrows over antitrust. \u003c/strong\u003eTogether, the two firms claim up to 70% of the registered investment advisor custody market, per KBW data cited by Reuters. The \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-td-ameritrade-m-a-charles-schwab/charles-schwab-in-talks-to-buy-smaller-rival-td-ameritrade-cnbc-idUSKBN1XV16S?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecombined company\u003c/a\u003e would have around $5 trillion in assets. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eindustry disruption has forced firms to shift focus from trading to managing those customer assets. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWeWork is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/21/wework-lays-off-2400-employees.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaying off\u003c/a\u003e 2,400 employees, nearly 20% of its global workforce. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat had been everyone’s favorite tragicomedy is now just a disaster. WeWork swung for an IPO in September but missed \u003cem\u003ebadly\u003c/em\u003e—investors decided that huge losses, a lack of focus, and sketchy corporate governance presented risks they weren’t willing to take. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThen, WeWork’s valuation sank from $47 billion to ~$8 billion following a bailout from the Japanese conglomerate SoftBank, which had already committed \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-16/softbank-said-to-plan-5-billion-rescue-financing-for-wework?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than $10 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to WeWork.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThis round of layoffs will inevitably be compared to the departure of cofounder Adam Neumann, who stepped down with an exit package worth around $1 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn a letter to management earlier this month, around 150 employees \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/08/business/wework-employees-letter.html?module=inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslammed Neumann\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. They wrote, “We don’t want to be defined by the scandals, the corruption, and the greed exhibited by the company’s leadership.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWeWork needs a drastic overhaul if it wants another crack at an IPO. max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoogle officially joined the “at least we’re doing more than Facebook” club and announced adjustments to political ad targeting this week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAdvertisers today can tailor ads to individuals’ political leanings (left, right, independent, Never Brewers). Moving forward, targeting categories are \u003ca href=\"https://www.blog.google/technology/ads/update-our-political-ads-policy/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebroadening\u003c/a\u003e to age, gender, postal code, and your internet browsing history. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChanges roll out in the U.K. in the next week, the EU by year’s end, and everywhere else Jan. 6. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGoogle said “demonstrably false claims” that could subvert electoral processes are still prohibited.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe rest of the pack\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast Friday, Twitter finally \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/15/twitter-gives-details-political-ad-policy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplained in detail\u003c/a\u003e the political ad ban taking effect today (including walking back an outright ban on \"issue-based\" advertisers). And Snap CEO Evan Spiegel \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/18/snapchat-fact-checks-political-ads-unlike-facebook-ceo-evan-spiegel.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e his platform has dedicated fact-checkers for ads. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEven Facebook’s trying to get away from what Facebook’s doing. Company execs are reportedly considering changes to \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/13/sen-elizabeth-warren-runs-knowingly-false-ads-check-facebook?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtroversial\u003c/a\u003e political ad policies, the WSJ \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-discussing-potential-changes-to-political-ad-policy-11574352887?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eFor social media companies, the debate over political ad policies
